statement.tex: \text{Prove that the logarithmic function is}\\ \text{strictly increasing on }\left(0,\infty\right).

reason.tex: y = \ln x \text{ makes sense only if }x\gt 0.
y\text{ has to be }\textbf{strictly}\text{ increasing }\\ \text{- not just increasing. Hence, }\frac{dy}{dx}\gt 0 - \text{not}\geq 0.
\text{We simply used a standard result, }\frac{d}{dx}\ln x=\frac{1}{x}.\\ \text{And given that }x\gt 0,\frac{1}{x}\gt 0\implies\frac{dy}{dx}\gt 0.
